gathering_videos.title: Deploying a RAG-Enhanced Llama 3.1 Chat Bot on OpenShift AI with Intel Gaudi Accelerators
gathering_videos.description: Discover how Intel Gaudi AI accelerators and Red Hat AI team up to deliver a powerful end-to-end generative AI solution. In this proof-of-concept demo, you’ll see how the Llama 3.1 model runs on four Intel Gaudi units, managed seamlessly by OpenShift’s AI-serving infrastructure. Explore the difference between non-RAG (non-retrieval augmented generation) queries and RAG queries augmented by a vector database for more accurate answers—and watch how that extra contextual data eliminates hallucinations.

gathering_videos.title: Monitor manufacturing at the edge using OpenShift AI
gathering_videos.description:
0:00 Moving AI to the edge
1:45 Preparing the inference container
3:20 Using a pipeline to build the image
6:13 Deploying the image to the edge
7:20 Monitoring the edge
8:12 Putting the pieces together

Monitoring manufacturing processes and the quality of the results can be improved by the use of AI, including sensors and computer vision. Combining AI with edge computing puts the intelligence at the point of observation. 

OpenShift AI can be used to deploy model serving, predict failure, detect anomalies, and do quality inspection in low-latency environments in near real-time. Model updates and monitoring are also supported using OpenShift AI.

 The demo shows how the model can be packaged into an inference container image and use data science pipelines to fetch models, build, test, deploy and update within a GitOps workflow. ArgoCD is used to detect changes and update the image at the edge devices if needed.  Observability into the model’s health and performance is provided by gathering metrics from edge devices and reporting back to centralized management. 

Learn more: https://red.ht/openshift_ai

gathering_videos.title: AI 101: What’s the difference between AI and ML?
gathering_videos.description:
Welcome to the AI 101 series where we demystify the basics of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to help you better understand basic AI concepts. We hope these videos help you start to apply AI to your organization’s strategy. Join us as we explore the foundations of AI.

In our debut video, Prasanth Anbalagan (Senior Principal Technical Marketing Manager for AI) will define and explore the basic concepts of Artificial Intelligence vs. Machine Learning (AI vs. ML). These terms are often confused and we want to help you better understand what each one is (and isn’t) as you move along in your AI journey. Prasanth compares and contrasts the technologies and provides clear examples of how they work.

In the comments section, please let us know future topics we should cover in AI 101.

Learn more at RedHat.com

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering, Raleigh - Artificial Intelligence at Red Hat: What's Next
gathering_videos.description: AI has embedded itself in every industry and every executive is looking at how to apply it to their space. Sherard Griffin (Red Hat) discusses how to leverage operational models and get them into production. Griffin introduces Red Hat OpenShift AI, generative AI for the open hybrid cloud.

gathering_videos.title: Simplifying the training and deployment of large foundation models
gathering_videos.description: Being able to quickly scale up or down OpenShift cluster resources becomes more critical as the fine-tuning of foundation models gains popularity.  Red Hat and IBM Research have worked together to open source a generative AI infrastructure stack that has been provided in Open Data Hub and is being productized as part of OpenShift AI. In this demo, Mustafa Eyceoz shows how you can use Ray, CodeFlare, and Multi-Cluster App Dispatcher (MCAD) technology to prioritize real-time access to cluster resources or schedule workloads for batch processing.

gathering_videos.title: Red Hat and NVIDIA Partner to Bring AI to the Enterprise
gathering_videos.description: How do you take generative AI and bring it into the enterprise sphere where it has all the support, all the ecosystem engagement, and all the accelerated infrastructure required to run it? NVIDIA's Amanda Saunders discusses how Red Hat and NVIDIA are partnering to make this possible.

gathering_videos.title: Unleashing AI for every organization with Red Hat OpenShift and NVIDIA
gathering_videos.description:
As more organizations start integrating AI applications in their business to deliver better insights and more value to their customers, they are also faced with the complexity of integrating these AI solutions with existing infrastructures, scaling them and keeping them accurate.
Red Hat and NVIDIA have partnered to unlock the power of AI for every business by delivering an end-to-end enterprise platform optimized for AI workloads.

Kick-start your AI journey with free access to NVIDIA AI Enterprise with Red Hat OpenShift. 
Visit our hands-on lab and try it today:  https://www.nvidia.com/red-hat-launchpad

gathering_videos.title: SWIFT and Red Hat OpenShift deliver an AI platform for financial transaction intelligence at scale
gathering_videos.description:
SWIFT is shaping the future of payments and securities to be faster, smarter and better. As the financial industry’s neutral and trusted provider, we help our community of over 11,000 financial institutions move value around the world reliably and more securely at scale. SWIFT is now leveraging our pivotal role in the financial industry to develop transformative AI solutions, enabled by a high-performance AI platform that is future ready for hybrid cloud. 

Join this keynote to learn how SWIFT, along with Red Hat, C3.ai, Kove and partner financial institutions, is embarking on a journey to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of shared services like payment screening and anomaly detection, leveraging unique global transaction data – without compromising the integrity of transaction data or the privacy of its users.

Speakers: Marius Bogoevici (Red Hat) and  Chalapathy Neti (SWIFT)

gathering_videos.title: Starburst partners with Red Hat on OpenShift Data Science for AI/ML workloads
gathering_videos.description: Justin Borgman, CEO of Starburst, describes how Starburst partners with Red Hat, integrating with Red Hat OpenShift Data Science to provide insights into an organization’s data for analytics and AI/ML workloads. Justin describes how the Starburst data mesh capabilities can help data engineers to access decentralized data and eliminate the need for data wrangling.

gathering_videos.title: Top 5 Considerations for an AI/ML Platform
gathering_videos.description: Will McGrath, Product Marketing Manager in Red Hat’s Data Services business unit, discusses the top 5 considerations for building out an AI platform. Whether it’s developing a data strategy or building a collaborative environment, these guidelines will help your organization achieve success as your machine learning projects move from experimentation to production.

gathering_videos.title: What is Kubeflow?
gathering_videos.description: In this short 45 second video, Juana Nakfour describes Kubeflow and its advantages.

gathering_videos.title: Using Open Data Hub for MLOps Demo
gathering_videos.description: Juana Nakfour describes MLOps and demonstrates how to use Open Data Hub, a community project integrating open source AI/ML tools in an end-to-end AI platform on Red Hat OpenShift. First, Juana shows using the JupyterHub Elyra tool to auto-generate and run an MLOps KubeFlow pipeline. After showcasing Red Hat Ceph Storage and bucket notification to trigger and automate the MLOps pipeline, Juana shows how to deploy the fraud detection neural network machine learning model using KFServing and using Canary rollout to introduce a new version of the model.

gathering_videos.title: How NTT and Red Hat have Built an Edge Offer to Deliver New Cloud-Native AI-Platform Services
gathering_videos.description: Learn how cloud-native AI applications can be enabled for a new digital service edge platform from NTT East. The Multi-Access Edge Computing (MEC) platform is based on a Red Hat OpenShift architecture leveraging GPUs and NVIDIA GPU-Operator to deliver new AI applications services across multi-cloud edge environments including private 5G, fiber, telco edge and customer’s enterprise edge. The cloud-native edge solution is  for multiple industry solutions and a next generation intelligent video analytics (IVA) example is highlighted for a retailer.

Explore the challenges this poses for Data Scientists and what OpenShift is doing to make productizing AI/ML models more simple with features like OpenShift GitOps, OpenShift Pipelines, Quay, and Red Hat OpenShift Data Science.

Red Hat OpenShift Data Science combines common open source tooling, partner software and other Red Hat portfolio software to provide a fully supported sandbox in which to rapidly develop, train, and test ML models in the public cloud. Chris Chase runs through a tutorial of how easy it is to launch Jupyter notebooks to build a model in a TensorFlow framework and deploy the model in a container-ready format.

gathering_videos.title: Using MPI Operator for GPU-Accelerated Workloads with Lustre FS David Gray Red Hat | NVIDIA GTC OSCG
gathering_videos.description:
David Gray
(Red Hat)
NVIDIA GTC OpenShift Commons Gathering
October 9, 2020
High performance computing workloads increasingly rely on containers that make applications easier to manage, preserve their dependencies, and add portability across different environments. Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform is an enterprise-ready Kubernetes-based platform for deploying containerized applications on shared compute resources. An Operator is a method of packaging, deploying, and managing a Kubernetes-native application that can make it easier to run complex workloads. We'll demonstrate how GPU-accelerated scientific applications can be deployed on OpenShift, using message-passing interface and backed by the Lustre file system for data storage.

gathering_videos.title: Why deploy AI/ML (Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning) workloads on OpenShift?
gathering_videos.description:
While organizations are turning to Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) to better serve customers, reduce cost, and gain other competitive advantages, there are significant challenges to executing these programs.

Data Scientists need a self-service experience that allows them to build, scale, and share their machine learning (ML) modeling results across the hybrid cloud.

With Red Hat OpenShift, you'll enable data scientists to easily enable and deploy their ML modeling without the dependency on IT to provision infrastructure.

Learn more at openshift.com/ai-ml

At OpenShift Commons Gathering Israel 2023, Steven Huels discusses the challenges and opportunities of integrating AI/ML into applications. OpenShift Commons Gathering Israel 2023
Language: English
Speaker: Liora Schechter, CIO, Clalit Health Services

In this session at OpenShift Commons Gathering Israel 2023, Liora Schechter, CIO of Clalit, discusses leading innovations in healthcare. She highlights the shift from physical encounters to virtual meetings and asynchronous requests, making healthcare more convenient for patients. 

Liora discusses how Clalit has been working with Red Hat to implement their OpenShift platform and utilize AI tools for personalized and proactive care. She showcases the groundbreaking "home ultrasound" device that allows pregnant women to monitor their baby's health and how it has already saved three lives. With remote monitoring and digital services, Clalit's vision is to develop a holistic and proactive digital healthcare platform.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons London 2025: Welcome to Commons
gathering_videos.description:
Aubrey Muhlach from Red Hat welcomes customers, OpenShift users, and community members to the OpenShift Commons Gathering in London at KubeCon EU 2025.  

OpenShift Commons Gathering KubeCon EU 2025
April 01, 2025  Live from KubeCon EU in London
Learn more at: https://commons.openshift.org

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons London Keynote: Balancing Security, Risk and Innovation - How Red Hat Helps
gathering_videos.description:
Kirsten Newcomer and Natale Vinto share insights and a demo series on Kubernetes security strategies in this era of rapid innovation and AI.  

OpenShift Commons Gathering KubeCon EU 2025
April 01, 2025  Live from KubeCon EU in London
Learn more at: https://commons.openshift.org

gathering_videos.title: Vodafone: Automating OpenShift in Telco with Validated Patterns Operator and GitOps
gathering_videos.description:
Tom Kivlin, Principal Cloud Architect at Vodafone, explores how Vodafone Networks has successfully implemented the Validated Patterns Operator in conjunction with GitOps to automate & simplify the lifecycle management of bare metal OpenShift clusters.

OpenShift Commons Gathering KubeCon EU 2025
April 01, 2025  Live from KubeCon EU in London
Learn more at: https://commons.openshift.org

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons London: The OpenShift Super Hero Awards
gathering_videos.description:
Amy Marrich, Principal Technical Marketing Manager at Red Hat, honors our OpenShift Super Heroes: 

Mike Whale - Lloyds
Jef Luyckx - Piros 
Loïc Mulder - ITS4U
Joris Cramwinckel - Ortec Finance
Mark de Jong - ING

OpenShift Commons Gathering KubeCon EU 2025
April 01, 2025  Live from KubeCon EU in London
Learn more at: https://commons.openshift.org

gathering_videos.title: Advanced Networking in OpenShift with Adobe: Adoption of Bring Your Own CNI for Cilium Integration
gathering_videos.description:
Kanika Gera, Senior Product Manager at Adobe, and Alexandru Dobre, Technical Lead Computer Scientist at Adobe discuss the adoption journey of OpenShift within Adobe, focusing on implementing a critical feature: Bring Your Own Container Network Interface (CNI), enabling the seamless integration of Cilium as the preferred CNI.

They, also, detail the challenges encountered when adopting Bring Your Own CNI in OpenShift, covering the architectural considerations, configuration complexities, and integration workflows. 

OpenShift Commons Gathering KubeCon EU 2025
April 01, 2025  Live from KubeCon EU in London
Learn more at: https://commons.openshift.org

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons London 2025: Worldpay’s Platform as a Product
gathering_videos.description:
Worldpay’s Matt Simons, Bernd Malmqvist, and Michal Umlawski explore how their company uses the “Platform as a Product” approach with RedHat OpenShift to create an intuitive, highly automated self-service platform at scale for their internal teams. 

OpenShift Commons Gathering KubeCon EU 2025
April 01, 2025  Live from KubeCon EU in London
Learn more at: https://commons.openshift.org

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons London 2025: A Day of Innovation
gathering_videos.description:
In this visual recap, experience the energy and expertise from OpenShift Commons London 2025, where AI, security, validated patterns, and edge computing took center stage. 

OpenShift Commons Gathering KubeCon EU 2025
April 01, 2025  Live from KubeCon EU in London
Learn more at: https://commons.openshift.org

gathering_videos.title: Wells Fargo: AI/ML Workloads with OpenShift—Scaling Innovation in the Financial Services Industry
gathering_videos.description:
Join this panel of industry experts as they discuss best practices for running AI/ML workloads on OpenShift, the role of Kubernetes in AI-driven applications, and real-world case studies demonstrating success in production environments. 

OpenShift Commons Gathering KubeCon EU 2025
April 01, 2025  Live from KubeCon EU in London
Learn more at: https://commons.openshift.org

gathering_videos.title: How ABB Enables Predictive Maintenance & Operator Effectiveness with AI at the Far Edge
gathering_videos.description: ABB serves a wide range of customers, from refineries to oil, gas, and power generation companies—industries that demand high efficiency, a data-driven approach, and the ability to harness operational data from production sites, applications, and the cloud. To meet these needs, ABB developed ABB Ability Edgenius, leveraging Red Hat OpenShift and Red Hat Device Edge. ABB’s Vikas Maurya and Anders Trosten elaborate on this solution.

gathering_videos.title: Red Hat customers build applications for the far Edge
gathering_videos.description: Red Hat Device Edge, now generally available, brings together Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), Red Hat's Ansible Automation Platform, and Red Hat MicroShift to offer the OpenShift experience at the far Edge. Shobhan Lakkapragada, Red Hat's Senior Director of Edge Computing, discusses what this means for manufacturing, retail, and industry.

gathering_videos.title: Paladin Cloud CTO Steve Hull on AI, cloud security, and open source
gathering_videos.description: It's been a year and a half since Paladin Cloud launched a cloud security management platform and prioritization engine. Steve Hull, Co-founder and CTO of Paladin Cloud, discusses the product's key features and how AI has reshaped the security landscape.

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons: How to Support Developers with Platform Engineering
gathering_videos.description:
Abby Bangser,  principal engineer of Syntasso, discusses the benefits of and considerations for building out an internal platform for enterprises.  The Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) Platforms Working Group, recently released a white paper called "Platform Engineering Maturity Model." Learn more here: https://maturitymodel.cncf.io/

http://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: The Future of AI: Sustainable Practices for Energy Reduction
gathering_videos.description:
Marlow Weston, Cloud Software Architect at Intel, discusses her work with the CNCF's Environmental Sustainability TAG to identify incentives for service providers to reduce power consumption and carbon footprints through cloud native tooling.

OpenShift Commons Gathering KubeCon Chicago
Learn more at: https://commons.openshift.org

You will want to attend this session if you are a system administrator, developer or just looking to better understand how Red Hat is partnering with Nvidia to improve the developer experience, support containerized applications, and enable GPU and vGPU accelerated workloads to run on Red Hat Enterprise Linux for both bare-metal and hybrid cloud environments.

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Salt Lake City: Step into the world of Virtualization with New York University
gathering_videos.description:
The New York University Research and Instructional Technology team talk about some of the exciting work they have in flight (and out of the doors) in the world of Virtualization. They have been focused on getting their OpenShift Virtualization environment production-ready. 

Lior Atar (NYU), Carl Evans (NYU), and Shane Baker (RH) discuss what this process has been like, how they are setting up the environment and the variety of applications (from VMs, HPC workloads, shiny new apps to migrated traditional apps that aren't quite ready for containerizing) running on it as well as how they decided which apps to modernize, migrate and retire. They also give a quick glimpse into what's coming and their exploration of the fun world of GitOps, service mesh, and AI!

OpenShift Commons Gathering Kubecon NA 2024
November 12, 2024,  Live from Kubecon NA in Salt Lake City, Utah 
Learn more at: https://commons.openshift.org

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons SLC: Mastercard Transforms Data Science with Cloud-Native Technologies
gathering_videos.description:
Mastercard's Alexander Hughes, Ravishankar Rao, and Red Hat's Diego Torres Fuerte discuss how Mastercard has transformed their Data Science Workbench (DSWB) to support advanced Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL) applications. Mastercard leveraged Red Hat OpenShift to build a robust, scalable, and flexible architecture that enables rapid experimentation and deployment of AI/ML workloads. Their new platform utilizes containerization, cloud-native tools, and automated deployment pipelines to deliver faster model training times, scalability of resources, and enhanced support for complex ML/DL projects. 

The team highlights the benefits they've observed, including improved operational efficiency, reduced time-to-market for new models, and increased innovation in AI and ML. The talk also covers the strategic decisions and lessons learned from our journey, providing insights for organizations looking to transform their data science capabilities and unlock the full potential of their teams.

OpenShift Commons Gathering Kubecon NA 2024
November 12, 2024,  Live from Kubecon NA in Salt Lake City, Utah 
Learn more at: https://commons.openshift.org

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Salt Lake City: Scaling app development at Frost Bank with OpenShift
gathering_videos.description:
In 2020, the Frost Bank infrastructure and development teams were frustrated with the slow roll outs, development, and updates to their application platform. They craved faster releases, zero downtime for maintenance and patching, and technology that adapted in alignment with the pace of their business. They landed on Red Hat OpenShift. Listen to the 'amigos' from Frost Bank who were the brains behind the OpenShift operation share their learnings about how their grassroots efforts went from standing up one solitary OpenShift cluster to scaling it out to run their main web banking portal.

gathering_videos.description:

* Managing secrets with HashiCorp Vault and Argo Vault plugin
* Using zero privilege principles to enhance security

gathering_videos.title: You're Invited: OpenShift Commons Gathering at Raleigh's historic Market Hall, October 18th
gathering_videos.description:
Join us on October 18 for the OpenShift Commons Gathering co-located with All Things Open 2023. Users, partners, customers, contributors and upstream project leads come together to collaborate across the OpenShift Cloud Native ecosystem.

https://commons.openshift.org/gatherings/raleigh-23-oct-18/

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering, Raleigh - Demos: Computer Vision and Reinforcement Learning
gathering_videos.description: Frank Lavigne (Red Hat) demos computer vision and reinforcement learning on Red Hat OpenShift at the OpenShift Commons 2023 Gathering in Raleigh, North Carolina.

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering, Raleigh - OpenShift Update and Roadmap
gathering_videos.description: Marc Curry (Red Hat) and Heather Heffner (Red Hat) discuss some of the main themes and directions Red Hat is going in with OpenShift.

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering, Raleigh - Red Hat: The Road Ahead
gathering_videos.description: Brian Gracely (Red Hat) looks at what challenges Red Hat OpenShift is resolving for customers and partners and how it continues to evolve.

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering, Raleigh - Ansible Lightspeed: The Evolution of Artificial Intelligence
gathering_videos.description: Matt Jones (Red Hat) speaks about Ansible Lightspeed and the potential of generative AI to transform enterprise automation.

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering, Raleigh - Artificial Intelligence at Red Hat: What's Next
gathering_videos.description: AI has embedded itself in every industry and every executive is looking at how to apply it to their space. Sherard Griffin (Red Hat) discusses how to leverage operational models and get them into production. Griffin introduces Red Hat OpenShift AI, generative AI for the open hybrid cloud.

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering, Raleigh - Will open source continue to dominate in the age of AI?
gathering_videos.description: Jeremy Eder (Red Hat) explores fundamental questions amid the recent surge in AI adoption:  What is open source AI, why is open AI important, and how will the industry arrive at a consensus?

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering, Raleigh - Brightly: Forging the Future, One Platform to Rule Them All
gathering_videos.description: Benjamin Issa (Brightly) and Shane Rowley (Red Hat) discuss the catalyst for Brightly’s digital transformation, building a platform-as-a-service that uses OpenShift at its core.

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Raleigh - A Zero Trust Identity Future
gathering_videos.description: Michael Peters, a principal engineer in Red Hat's emerging tech team, discusses the future of workload and software identity management.

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Raleigh - Ask me Anything
gathering_videos.description: AMA with Red Hat Engineers, Product Managers, Project Leads and Guest Speakers

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering, Raleigh - Crunchy Data Lightning Talk: AI for Postgres
gathering_videos.description: Bob Pacheco (Crunchy Data) explores these key questions: What does postgres have to do with AI? Why postgres at all?

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering, Raleigh - Red Hat CoreOS Layering Update
gathering_videos.description: Dusty Mabe (Red Hat) gives some updates on the CoreOS Layering effort within Red Hat and OpenShift.

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering, Raleigh - Kyndryl: Building a Developer Platform with OpenShift
gathering_videos.description: Robin Price (Kyndryl) discusses Kyndryl’s modernization journey.

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering, Raleigh: OKD Overview and Community Update
gathering_videos.description: The Red Hat Engineering OKD Streams team as well as the community are now able to build and release not only the stable builds of OKD but also the latest developments coming in OpenShift as dev previews on both Fedora CoreOS and CentOS Stream CoreOS. Heather Heffner (Red Hat) discusses these different releases, dubbed ‘OKD Streams’.

gathering_videos.title: ODCN’s journey to connecting OpenShift clusters securely and transparently with Submariner
gathering_videos.description:
OpenShift Commons Gathering at Kubecon/EU 2021
May 4th, 2021

Title: ODCN’s journey to connecting OpenShift clusters securely and transparently with Submariner 

Speakers:
Martijn Straatman (ODC-Noord)
Stephen Kitt (Red Hat)

Abstract:
This talk will present a proof of concept built by ODC-Noord, from the perspective of the customer and of the engineers working at Red Hat. 
We will discuss the proof of concept as well as the collaboration itself. Overheidsdatacenter Noord (ODCN) provides modern, sustainable and reliable IT infrastructure for the Dutch government, running Kubernetes containers since 2018 on Tectonic, then OpenShift, on an OpenStack-based cloud. ODCN hosts a growing number of workloads, on multiple clusters, and the next step is to improve reliability by connecting clusters in different datacenters. Submariner provides secure connectivity between Kubernetes clusters, with transparent and configurable access to pods and services in other clusters. ODCN and Red Hat worked together to establish whether Submariner could meet ODCN’s requirements. The proof of concept got ODCN up to speed quickly on this new technology, and helped Red Hat drive the project’s roadmap in a customer-centric manner.

https://commons.openshift.org/gatherings/OpenShift_Commons_Gathering_at_Kubecon_EU.html

gathering_videos.title: Using Text Analytics and AI to reduce GDPR risk - Filippo Sassi (Version1)
gathering_videos.description:
OpenShift Commons Gathering at Kubecon/EU
May 4th, 2021

Title: Using Text Analytics and AI to reduce GDPR risk - Filippo Sassi (Version1)
Speaker:  Filippo Sassi (Version1)
Abstract: 
Want the power of text analytics but can't or won't use cloud-based services? No problem! In this talk, Filippo Sassi (Version1) will tell you how we leveraged the power of open source technology to mitigate GDPR risk, using best of breed open-source text analytics and AI services. Deployed on our customer's Openshift cluster, this solution now provides a broad text analytics capability which will be applied to many use cases beyond GDPR.

Discusses implementation at Ireland's Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine https://www.gov.ie/en/organisation/department-of-agriculture-food-and-the-marine/

https://commons.openshift.org/gatherings/OpenShift_Commons_Gathering_at_Kubecon_EU.html

Abstract: 
BOK is an acronym for "Bank of Oklahoma". The company's banking subsidiary BOKF, NA operates in 8 states under the brands Bank of Oklahoma, Bank of Texas, Bank of Albuquerque, and BOK Financial (in Arizona, Arkansas, Colorado, Kansas, and Missouri). Bank of Oklahoma made a decision to modernize their IBM FileNet Content Management Suite in early 2020 by migrating to a container-based infrastructure. With the overall goal to improve development, delivery, and reliability for developers & operations on-premise & in the cloud for the bank. With this new environment based on Red Hat OpenShift 4x is able to scale its content management solution, reduce application delivery times while creating a scalable, vendor agnostic foundation for future cloud adoption.

gathering_videos.title: End to End OCP 4 clusters deployment automation in IT context at Amadeus
gathering_videos.description:
OpenShift Commons Gathering at Kubecon/EU 2021

Title: 
End to End OCP 4 clusters deployment automation in IT context at Amadeus

Speakers:

Thibaud Castaing (Amadeus)
Maria Emmanuelli (Red Hat)
Vincent Bronikowski (Red Hat)

Abstract:

Who doesn’t like listening to a success story full of challenges and wins? This story starts with a challenge, with the covid-19 pandemic. The project’s objective was to repurpose abandoned blades, by using OSP. It involves an innovative way to save resources and reduce the business impact of covid-19, using Red Hat Solutions. We’ll share the story of how Red Hat worked with Amadeus following Agile principles to deliver a disconnected install of OpenShift 4.6 with Calico on OpenStack. This process was automated End to End by combining several technologies into a tool following while adhering to Amadeus' need for synergy across platforms.This automation allows for the creation of clusters on demand in a repeatable way, serving as Cluster as a Service. Interested already?  There’s more. Because a demo is worth a thousand words, we will show you the automation tool and share Amadeus’ testimony.

https://commons.openshift.org/gatherings/OpenShift_Commons_Gathering_at_Kubecon_EU.html

gathering_videos.title: Cost & Resource Management of Modern CI/CD infrastructure with OpenShift at SIX Digital Exchange
gathering_videos.description:
OpenShift Commons Gathering  2021 at  KubeconEU
May 4, 2021

Title:
Cost & Resource Management of Modern CI/CD infrastructure with OpenShift

Speakers:
Saulius Prasmantas (SIX Digital Exchange)
Radu Domnu (Red Hat) 
Marcel Haerri (Red Hat)

Abstract:
Operating modern CI/CD infrastructure requires a balance between fast resource availability during peak development time and cost optimization during downtime. With scalability features such as the Machine API and cluster autoscaler, OpenShift 4 can provide on-demand elasticity for development teams by enabling self-provisioning build servers and deployment environments, while at the same time optimize cloud platform costs by automatically expiring deployed workloads and removing temporary resources. In this session experts from the SIX Digital Exchange (SDX) and Red Hat Services will share their expertise on how to optimize GitLab CI runners on Openshift. You will learn - how easily you can run elastic Gitlab CI runners on OpenShift - how cluster autoscaler can help to scale infrastructure up and down based on developer demand - how to cut infrastructure cost, by automatically down scaling expired development environments - how to address provisioning latency of VMs on cloud platforms

gathering_videos.title: Streamlining OpenShift Developer Experience by Building an Enterprise Helm Chart Repository Discover
gathering_videos.description:
OpenShift Commons Gathering at Kubecon/EU 2021
May 4th 2021

Title: Streamlining the OpenShift Developer Experience by Building an Enterprise Helm Chart Repository

Speakers:
Sachin Chavda (Discover Financial Services)
Austin Dewey (Red Hat)

Abstract:
Developers have busy schedules when it comes to meeting deadlines. Using OpenShift accelerates delivery, but it takes time out of a developer’s schedule to become proficient, which can put deadlines at risk. To avoid this risk, OpenShift admins within the enterprise must provide a streamlined developer experience. Admins can provide such an experience by building an enterprise Helm chart repository. This repository contains Helm charts that abstract the complexity of deploying applications to OpenShift. The Helm charts do the heavy lifting of configuring OpenShift resources, so all the developer has to do is install the Helm chart using a single command from the Helm CLI. By using Helm charts, the developer experience on OpenShift is streamlined and allows developers to stay focused on meeting their deadlines. In this session, participants will learn how to design and build an enterprise Helm chart repository that will help drive OpenShift adoption within their organization.

https://commons.openshift.org/gatherings/OpenShift_Commons_Gathering_at_Kubecon_EU.html

gathering_videos.title: Lessons Learned Adopting RHEL Container Tools: Podman, Buildah, Quay, Skopeo, Clair and S2I
gathering_videos.description:
OpenShift Commons Gathering at Kubecon EU 2021 

Title: Lessons Learned Adopting RHEL Container Tools: Podman, Buildah, Quay, Skopeo, Clair and S2I 

Speakers:
Elif Mosessohn-Samedin (Take Off Labs)
Mihai Criveti (IBM)

Abstract:
A hands-on demonstration of lessons learned migrating from other container build tools to the RHEL container ecosystem. We aim to explore a set of command-line tools that are able to operate without a container daemon, and namely: Buildah, Podman, Quay and Skopeo. In a nutshell, Buildah builds, Podman runs, and Skopeo transfers container images and Quay provides private and public container registries. We also look at best practices for building images that can easily be integrated into a CI/CD pipeline and vulnerability scanning with Clair and replacing previous build tools in our workflows. Understanding the impact of SELinux, namespaces and cgroups. Building container images for OpenShift. Replacing docker-compose with pods and adopting podman for testing ansible playbooks.

gathering_videos.title: Red Hat OpenShift Commons Gathering at KubeCon EU 2023
gathering_videos.description:
Red Hat OpenShift Commons Gathering at KubeCon EU 2023 in Amsterdam, The Netherlands. Join community members as they collaborate on a variety of topics on April 18, 2023. 

https://commons.openshift.org/join/

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Welcome to the Commons: Unlock the Potential of Collaboration
gathering_videos.description:
Karena Angell (Red Hat) welcomes attendees to OpenShift Commons Gathering, Amsterdam 2023, with a talk about the power of collaboration.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: OpenShift Release and Road Map Update, Spring 2023
gathering_videos.description:
Vanessa Martini (Red Hat) and Naina Singh (Red Hat) detail the roadmap for OpenShift, including the plans for OpenShift 4.14 and beyond.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Deploying Traditional Business Critical Applications
gathering_videos.description:
Martin Reiling (Achmea) speaks about the best practices and pitfalls of migrating traditional business-critical workloads to a cloud native environment.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Lightning Talk: OpenShift for AI Powered Applications
gathering_videos.description:
Myriam Fentanes (Red Hat) explains how Open Data Hub and OpenShift can enable the usage of AI/ML to power application workloads.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Modernizing with OpenShift on AWS using ROSA
gathering_videos.description:
Roland Barcia (Amazon Web Services) details the path to modernization on Red Hat OpenShift Service on AWS.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Lightning Talk: Cloud Controller Managers - Going Default
gathering_videos.description:
Michael McCune (Red Hat) Bridget Kromhout (Microsoft) discuss the changes coming to the cloud controller managers of the Kubernetes project.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Case Study: CERN's Journey with OpenShift and OKD
gathering_videos.description:
Jack Henschel (CERN) details the work CERN has done to enable the Large Hadron Collider and other complex particle physics experiments to ingest large amounts of data, analyze it, and share it with the world.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Sustainability with Project Kepler
gathering_videos.description:
Huamin Chen (Red Hat) discusses Red Hat's initiatives around sustainability.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Case Study: Observability Feedback with Amadeus
gathering_videos.description:
Augustin Husson (Amadeus IT Group) and Alban Hurtaud (Amadeus IT Group) explain the lessons they've learned working to increase Observability into Amadeus' application services.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Lightning Talk: Providing Disaster Recovery for ROSA Clusters
gathering_videos.description:
Luis Rico (NetApp) and Patric Uebele (NetApp) show off NetApp Astra Control, and how it can be used to provide disaster recovery services for Red Hat OpenShift Service on AWS (ROSA).

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Panel: Cloud-native Platforms: What and Why?
gathering_videos.description:
Josh Gavant (Red Hat), Abby Bangser (Syntasso), Raffaele Spazzoli (Red Hat), Andrew Block (Red Hat) and Thomas Vitale (Systematic) talk about platform engineering, and the benefits it can bring to an enterprise.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: From Micro to Mighty: A Guide to Customizing Edge Devices
gathering_videos.description:
Ricardo Noriega De Soto (Red Hat) and Miguel Angel Ajo Pelayo (Red Hat) discuss integrating customized hardware edge devices with OpenShift.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Case Study:  Addressing Customer Workload Isolation and Tenancy
gathering_videos.description:
Piotr Godowski (IBM) details IBM's patterns for dealing with large scale enterprise applications that require workload isolation using the OpenShift Lifecycle Manager.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Keycloak the Open Source Identity and Access Mgmt for Modern Apps
gathering_videos.description:
Alexander Schwartz (Red Hat) shows off the features of Keycloak. https://www.keycloak.org/

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Case Study: Keycloak for Securing APIs
gathering_videos.description:
Yuichi Nakamura (Hitachi), explains how Keycloak enables secure APIs in cloud-native environments. https://www.keycloak.org/

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Network Functions Virtualization and Edge Strategy
gathering_videos.description:
Almog Elfassy, Red Hat, explains the evolution from Network Functions Virtualization to Cloud Native Network Functions to enable next generation edge capabilities for telcos.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Pixels down the Pipe: Powering GeForce NOW with KubeVirt
gathering_videos.description:
Fabian Deutsch (Red Hat) and Ryan Hallisey (NVIDIA) show off how NVIDIA built its NVIDIA NOW online remote gaming service with KubeVirt.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Case Study: Workload Deployment Quality and Learning from Outages
gathering_videos.description:
Mark de Jong (ING) and Rob de Boer (ING) discuss ING's system for rating the quality of software packages.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Scale Vertically with Control Plane Machine Sets
gathering_videos.description:
Joel Speed (Red Hat) and Damiano Donati (Red Hat) show off the latest features around Hosted Control Planes, which allows for scaling of Kubernetes control nodes.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Lightning Talk: Common Extensible Language and Kubernetes
gathering_videos.description:
David Eads, Red Hat shows off what the Common Expression Language can do to enable static validation, type safety and policy conformance.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Case Study: France, Ministry of Interior
gathering_videos.description:
Eric Tiquet, Deputy Minister, France Ministry of the Interior, discusses the development platform France has built for its internal infrastructure, based on OpenShift.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Using OpenShift Serverless to Kickstart Cloud Native Adoption
gathering_videos.description:
Norris Sam Osarenkhoe (SVA GmbH) discusses how OpenShift Serverless infrastructure can help developers adopt cloud native application patterns.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: AMA with Red Hat Engineers, Product Managers and Leads
gathering_videos.description:
Speakers, contributors, engineers and other members of the community take the time to answer questions from the audience. Lead by Karena Angell.

https://commons.openshift.org/join

gathering_videos.title: OpenShift Commons, Amsterdam 2023: Community Heroes
gathering_videos.description:
Karena Angell (Red Hat) closes out OpenShift Commons Gathering, Amsterdam 2023, by honoring community heroes who have helped fuel collaboration in the open source community. Honorees include Jack Henschel (CERN), David Eads (Red Hat), Michael McCune (Red Hat contributor to the OKD working group), Ellen Knol (Red Hat), and Diane Mueller (Red Hat).

https://commons.openshift.org/join
